atlantis-free: A free constraint-based optimization and SAT solver that targets combinatorial problems, offering hybrid modeling and efficient search strategies across diverse domains.
cbc-free: COIN-OR Branch-and-Cut (CBC) is an open-source MILP solver specializing in integer and linear optimization, widely used as a robust and lightweight alternative to commercial engines.
choco-solver__cp_-free: A free configuration of Choco Solver, a Java-based constraint programming toolkit supporting finite domain constraints and offering customizable search strategies for discrete optimization.
choco-solver__cp_-par: A parallel configuration of Choco Solver that exploits multi-threaded search, improving runtimes on hard combinatorial problems while retaining its flexible Java modeling interface.
choco-solver__cp-sat_-free: A Choco Solver mode that integrates CP with SAT-style reasoning to handle complex and hybrid combinatorial models more efficiently in a free configuration.
chuffed-free: A free, high-performance CP solver leveraging Lazy Clause Generation to combine SAT-like learning with traditional CP techniques, especially suited for rich scheduling and routing tasks.
cp_optimizer-free: A free edition of IBM CP Optimizer, a powerful constraint programming solver tailored for scheduling, planning, and sequencing, providing strong propagation and heuristic search.
cplex-free: A no-cost version of IBM CPLEX, a top-tier solver supporting LP, MILP, and QP, known for fast branch-and-bound, presolve, and cutting-plane methods; commonly used in academia.
gurobi-free: A free (typically academic) version of Gurobi, a leading commercial solver for LP, MILP, QP, and more, recognized for state-of-the-art performance, parallelization, and tuning tools.
highs-free: An open-source suite for LP, MILP, and QP that includes simplex and interior-point methods; designed to be lightweight, modern, and easy to integrate into scientific workflows.
huub-free: A free constraint programming solver supporting expressive modeling and modern search heuristics, positioned for practical combinatorial decision and scheduling tasks.
izplus-free: A free solver from the MiniZinc ecosystem that blends constraint and logic programming; supports expressive modeling and integrates cleanly with MiniZinc workflows.
jacop-free: JaCoP is an open-source Java CP solver providing advanced propagators and search heuristics, especially popular in education and prototyping of discrete decision models.
or-tools_cp-sat-free: A free solver from Google OR-Tools implementing CP-SAT, combining SAT learning with MILP-style reasoning to efficiently solve large-scale scheduling and routing models.
or-tools_cp-sat_ls-free: A variant of OR-Tools CP-SAT with local-search and metaheuristic enhancements, suited for large or highly-structured combinatorial optimization models.
picatsat-free: A free SAT/CP-hybrid solver integrated with the Picat language, enabling concise modeling with logic, tabling, and pattern-based constructs for combinatorial tasks.
pumpkin-free: A free SAT and Max-SAT solver aimed at optimization-centric Boolean reasoning, providing clause learning and heuristics suitable for decision and cost-based models.
scip-free: A free solver that unifies mixed-integer programming and constraint programming with nonlinear extensions; known for strong presolve, cutting planes, and flexibility.
sicstus_prolog-free: A free edition of SICStus Prolog that blends Prolog with constraint logic programming capabilities, enabling expressive models for combinatorial reasoning and inference.
yuck-free: A free constraint-based solver employing heuristics and local search to tackle combinatorial, optimization, and scheduling problems with concise modeling constructs.
